Journal: Journal Of Behavior Therapy And Experimental Psychiatry
Title: Can concreteness training buffer against the negative effects of rumination on ptsd? an experimental analogue study
Author: Schaich, Anja; Watkins, Edward R.; Ehring, Thomas
ResultSummary: No group difference on the immediate post trauma film intrusion frequency measured by intrusion questionnaire between Abstract and Concrete processing style group
Notes_fromMo: Contact author for mean/SD. In this article, they combined lab intrusion questionnaire immediate post film and post trauma film reminder. Here I coded them separately; Also they did not provide the mean/SD for each group, but only have the regression parameters

Journal: Journal Of Behavior Therapy And Experimental Psychiatry
Title: Can concreteness training buffer against the negative effects of rumination on ptsd? an experimental analogue study
Author: Schaich, Anja; Watkins, Edward R.; Ehring, Thomas

Title: The impact of perceived self-efficacy on memory for aversive experiences
Author: Brown, Adam D.; Joscelyne, Amy; Dorfman, Michelle L.; Marmar, Charles R.; Bryant, Richard A.
ResultSummary: Individuals in the HSE condition had significantly fewer visual intrusions than individuals in the LSE condition, 24 hour after the film
Notes_fromMo: This paper reported film-related distress, does it count as intrusion-related distress?

Title: Does transcranial direct current stimulation affect post-stressor intrusive memories and rumination? an experimental analogue study
Author: Voss, Maria; Ehring, Thomas; Wolkenstein, Larissa
ResultSummary: Both conditions did not significantly in terms of intrusion frequency
Notes_fromMo: How to classify the tdcs study as behavioural, neural etc? Used an intrusion questionnaire not previously used in other studies~ is this study eligible for our meta?
